title: How to use 'There is' plus 'the' with nouns like “the floor” (definite article, existentials, English) - Quora

response.answer_text: I think you probably don’t. There is… in the sense of there exists probably doesn’t make sense with a definite article. If you say there’s the coffee cup, it’s not existential there—it means it’s over there. It can be replaced by here is the coffee cup. If I say, There’s a problem with the coffeemaker, that cannot be rephrased as here’s a problem with the coffeemaker. This is existential There. I can’t use a definite article and say the problem. But if I say, Where’s the coffeemaker? Here’s the coffeemaker. there’s the coffeemaker, then it’s an adverb of place. And it uses the definite article. So my sense is that Existential there precludes the definite article.
